info.title: OPEN511
info.description: This API is DriveBC's implementation of the Open511 specification.  It provides information about known road events (traffic accidents, construction, etc.) in British Columbia, Canada.

get.summary: The events resource provides information about road events (e.g. accidents, construction, special events)

parameters.description: Limits the response to events having a given status. The possible values are: [ACTIVE, ARCHIVED, ALL].  The default value is ALL.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Limits the response to events tagged with one of the listed severity values. The possible values are: [MINOR, MODERATE, MAJOR].  Multiple values may be listed, and should be separated by a comma. The default is to return events of any severity.
parameters.name: severity

parameters.description: Limits the response to events reported by a given jurisdiction. The value given must be specified as the ID of a jurisdiction returned by the /jurisdiction resource. The default is to return events from all jurisdictions.
parameters.name: jurisdiction

parameters.description: Limits the response to events tagged with one of the listed event types.  The possible values include: [CONSTRUCTION, INCIDENT, SPECIAL_EVENT, WEATHER_CONDITION].  Multiple values may be listed, and should be separated by a comma. The default is to return events of all types.
parameters.name: event_type

parameters.description: Limits the response to events tagged with one of the listed event subtypes.  The allowed values depend on the event_type.  For example, some of the possible event subtypes corresponding to event type CONSTRUCTION are [ROAD_MAINTENANCE, ROAD_CONSTRUCTION]. Multiple event subtypes may be listed, and should be separated by a comma. The default is to return events of all subtypes.
parameters.name: event_subtype

parameters.description: Limits the response to events based on the date and time that the event was created (first recorded). The date/time must be specified in ISO 8601 format, and may be prefixed by one of the following operators [<, <=, >, >=] to indicate 'before', 'before or equal to', 'after' or 'after or equal to' respectively.  For example, >2013-12-01T12:00:00Z requests all events create after Dec. 1, 2015 at 12pm (noon) Coordinated Universal Time.  The default is to return events with any creation time.
parameters.name: created

parameters.description: Limits the response to events based on the date and time that the event was last updated. The date/time must be specified in ISO 8601 format, and may be prefixed by one of the following operators [<, <=, >, >=] to indicate 'before', 'before or equal to', 'after' or 'after or equal to' respectively.  For example, >2013-12-01T12:00:00Z requests all events updated after Dec. 1, 2015 at 12pm (noon) Coordinated Universal Time. The default is to return events with any update time
parameters.name: updated

parameters.description: Limits the response to events on a given road as specified by the road name.  An example of a valid road name is 'Highway 1'. The default is to return events on all roads.
parameters.name: road_name

parameters.description: Limits the response to events within one of the specified areas.  An area must be specified as the ID of an item returned by the /areas resource. For example: an area_id of 'drivebc.ca/5' limits events to those within the Okanagan-Shuswap District.  The default is to return events in all areas.
parameters.name: area_id

parameters.description: Limits the response to events that fall within the specified geographical bounding box.  The bbox format must be '[min longitude],[min latitude],[max longitude],[max latitude]' with WGS84 coordinates.  For example: -123.45,48.99,-122.45,49.49.  The default is to return events in all geographical locations.
parameters.name: bbox

parameters.description: Must be specified together with 'tolerance' to limit the response to events that are within the specified distance of a geographical location. The geography value should be provided as a WKT string in WGS84 latitude/longitude. For example: POINT (-73.64 45.52). The default is to return events in all geographical locations.
parameters.name: geography

parameters.description: Must be specified together with 'geography' to limit the response to events that are within the specified distance of a geographical location. The tolerance is a radius specified in metres. The default is to return events in all geographical locations.
parameters.name: tolerance

parameters.description: Limits the response to events that are, according to their schedules, in effect at a specific time, or during a specific time period.  The value must be specified as a single date/time in ISO 8601 format, or as a start and end time separated by a comma. Some examples are: '2014-12-31T23:59' or '2013-06-20T00:00,2013-06-20T23:59'.  The default is to return events in effect at any time
parameters.name: in_effect_on

parameters.description: Asks for the response in a specific output format.  The possible values are: [xml, json].  The default is to return json.
parameters.name: format

get.summary: The areas resource provides a list of the geographical areas (e.g. districts) that can be used to filter events.

parameters.description: Asks for the response in a specific output format.  The possible values are: [xml, json].  The default is to return json.
parameters.name: format
